episodes.title: New Blood: 01x10 - Sins of the Father

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: - On the surface, Iron Lake may seem like the idyllic snow globe town Norman Rockwell would jerk off to.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: But I came here because an overprivileged, cis, white boy named Matt Caldwell went hunting in the woods one day and never came back.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: So, of course, everyone lost their g*dd*mn minds.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: Especially Matt's father, local legend Kurt Caldwell, who claims his son is still alive.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: But if that's true, - where is he?

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: What unfolded next, m*rder fiends, was more than any true crime podcaster could ever dream of.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: Dark secrets lurk beneath Iron Lake, and the more I do the deep dive, the more I come up with.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: At this rate, I may never have to leave.

dialogue.speaker: MOLLY
dialogue.text: You're listening to Merry f*cking k*ll.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: This is Chief Angela Bishop, Iron Lake P.D.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I need you to put out an APB on someone who's been missing for hours.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: All right, what's the name of the missing person?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Now I remember why I picked this place.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: All these people working together to help me, Mr. Serial k*ller.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Make that Mr. Serial k*ller and son.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: If I'm going to teach Harrison the Code, it can't be here.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You want to grab, uh, a coffee?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: No, we need to talk now.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: There's strong evidence that your fire was arson.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: 'Cause Gig's been warning me about that fire pit for...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Someone drenched your roof with an accelerant, most likely gasoline, which makes this a crime scene.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Can you think of anyone you crossed recently?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It was probably those Moose Creek douchebags.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Uh, a few of 'em tried to jump me at the-at the truck stop two nights ago.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Uh, they were-they were friends with that kid, Jeremy.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Uh, Zach or Scott probably know who they are.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He truly is his father's son.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: ... and any other details you can remember.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Anything here you want to keep?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I'm gonna stay and poke around a little more.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Uh, took up a collection to help out.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: We, uh, we wanted to get you a little something special.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Thought you might be able to use a new jacket.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Hey, it's from all of us.

dialogue.speaker: HARRISON
dialogue.text: You guys are too nice in this town.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: There was a time I would've given anything to see him like this.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Happy. Embraced by friends. Almost normal.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Okay, okay. Come on, come on.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Let's pack up the-the boxes and put them in Jim's truck.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: So... after last night, we should probably figure out where we want to live.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Can't stay at Angela's place forever.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You mean away from Iron Lake?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I mean, I-I-I finally feel like I fit in.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And you've done a great job, but think about how good a fresh start will feel.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's kind of like Miami, but without all that humidity.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's , miles away from my friends.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I know it's hard, but we can't be ourselves here.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We can't do what we do.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: how does... "what we do" work, exactly?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: we see someone getting away with m*rder, and...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's not hard to do when you're in a big city.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And then, when our Dark Passenger rises up, we'll be ready.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Like during your wrestling match, when you broke that kid's arm.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Except, instead of hurting someone innocent, we bring justice to someone who deserves it.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And save a lot of innocent people.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Yeah, we can definitely get a pool.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: So, uh, when are you gonna tell Angela?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I'll let you know when the time is right.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Hey, could you follow up on a few Moose Creek kids?

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: It seemed, I don't know, cozy.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Can't-can't go wrong with pasta, but you got to do it right.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Would you guys mind going to Gig's for some crushed red pepper and parmesan?

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Yeah. You got it. Come on.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Oh, and, uh, caramel fudge ice cream?

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Yeah, get two. We all deserve it.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Is my cabin still burned down?

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Hey, tell me what's going on...

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Wh... You're taking the whole role-playing thing to the next level.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Shut the f*ck up and do what I say.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: What the hell is this about?

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: 'Cause there's at least a few options.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Dexter Morgan, you're under arrest for the m*rder of Matthew Stearn Caldwell.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Get him the f*ck out of my house.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: You have the right to remain silent.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Yes, okay, your chief already told me to shut the f*ck up.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: ♪ Let me back, let me back ♪ ♪ I promise to be good ♪ ♪ Don't look in the mirror ♪ ♪ At the face you don't recognize ♪ ♪ Help me, call the doctor ♪ ♪ Put me inside, put me inside ♪ ♪ Put me inside, put me inside, put me inside ♪ ♪ I keep the wolf from the door ♪ ♪ But he calls me up, ooh ♪ - Ange...

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: Oh, we'll be talking. A lot.

dialogue.speaker: AUDREY
dialogue.text: ♪ And I'll never see them again ♪ ♪ If I squeal to the cops ♪ ♪ No-no-no, no ♪ ♪ No, no-no-no ♪ ♪ No-no-no, no-no-no, no-no-no-no ♪ ♪ No-no-no-no ♪ ♪ No-no-no-no, no-no-no ♪ ♪ Someone else is gonna come and clean it up ♪ ♪ Born and raised for the job someone always does ♪ ♪ I wish you'd get up, get over ♪ ♪ Get up, get over, turn your tape off ♪ ♪ I keep the wolf from the door ♪ ♪ But he calls me up, calls me ♪ ♪ On the phone, tells me all the ways ♪ ♪ That he's gonna mess me up ♪ ♪ Steal all my children ♪ ♪ If I don't pay the ransom ♪ ♪ I'll never see them again ♪ ♪ If I squeal to the cops ♪ ♪ So I'm just gonna ♪ Dad? What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I'll talk to you in a bit.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: For the record, please state your name.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Where were you the day Matt Caldwell went missing?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We've determined that this person - is Matt Caldwell.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You remember when I came in and identified that distinctive r*fle for you?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Do you really have no sense of sarcasm?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I... We never identified the second person out in the woods that morning.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What's interesting is he has the same build as you, the same r*fle you own.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He even does that same chin scratch thing you do.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Well, my body size is average, - which means...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And dozens of people in Iron Lake have that same r*fle.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Hell, I personally sold most of them.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And I don't really know what you mean about...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You know that Matt Caldwell shattered his femur in that boating accident in Ohio?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I'd heard that. What about it?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: These are the type of screws and plate used to repair that sort of fracture.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And I found them in my mailbox, along with...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Come on, Ange, you're better than this.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: in the ashes of your cabin.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Remember when I said these are the type of screws and plate used on surgeries like Matt?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: These are the actual screws and plate used on Matt.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: They've got serial numbers, so I called the Cleveland Clinic and...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You went for your morning walk...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: No, I was home all day, except for work and...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: ... where you saw Matt k*ll the white deer.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Not hard to do, considering Matt was always an as*h*le.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Or maybe you're jumping to conclusions that aren't there.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And then Harrison shows up out of nowhere...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: ... and you had to get rid of Matt's body.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And what's your theory on that one?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: A fact I've become painfully aware of.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You want to hear it, or are you just gonna tell me to shut the f*ck up?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Kurt lied about Matt being in New York.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And then he lied about Matt being at that cabin of his.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And then Kurt stripped that same cabin down to the studs a day after your friend, Molly and I were there.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: So, it's not outside the realm of good, logical theory that Kurt k*lled Matt for any number of accidental or intentional reasons.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You yourself said, "Matt was always an as*h*le."

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Then he needed someone to frame.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Why not the boyfriend of the chief of police who just arrested and humiliated him?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Hell, Kurt probably burned down my cabin just so you'd find that damn screw.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Don't you see? He set me up.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: he's trying to get back at you.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Look, you've been under a ton of pressure lately.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: you just found your best friend's body after so long.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You haven't even had a chance to grieve for...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Why don't we just give Jim...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Dexter... some time to gather his thoughts?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We want to keep this interview clean, so it stands up in court.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: But his story seems to be just on this side of plausible to me, which means it'll seem plausible to a jury and the D.A.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You don't know the full f*cking context.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And if there is a full f*cking context, you might want to fill me in.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I got to be sure this time.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Anything on the Molly Park APB?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Nothing yet, but I forwarded the line to my cell.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Logan will bring you in to see your father.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Angela thinks I k*lled Matt Caldwell.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: This has nothing to do with Kurt.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Hey, I've been in tougher spots.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: There's no way I'm leaving you.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Angela's got this... theory, but it'll never hold up.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We'll be on the road in a day or two.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Well, what am I supposed to do till then?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Go find Tess at The Tavern.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: She'll feed you and give you a room.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Turn around. Hands behind your back.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I hope you are, too, for Harrison's sake.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I can't give you all the details yet, but...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You know how Harrison told you Jim wasn't his real name?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You said Harrison was high and didn't mean it.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I didn't know it at the time, but there's more to that story.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Like what? What the hell is going on?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Honey, I know this might be hard to believe...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Then why were you dating him?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Why'd you let him into our house?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Sometimes people aren't who you think they are.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I promise I will tell you everything tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Turn around. Hands through the slot.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: It's really putting me in touch with my fear of Harrison growing up without a father.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Go to the far side of the cell.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I'm gonna go make sure that Harrison is set up okay.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Oh, you're doing me a favor.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I know this must be really, really tough for you.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I'm not the one in jail.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I don't want to see Jim go away, either.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Look, you got here around the same time Matt disappeared.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Did you hear or-or see anything that could help exonerate your dad?

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I-I wasn't in town yet, so I... can't help.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Are you gonna finish your fries?

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I should head back to the station.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: Oh, and, uh, try not to eat hamburgers three meals a day.

dialogue.speaker: NUTS.
dialogue.text: I don't want you going up too many weight classes before wrestling starts after New Year's.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP.
dialogue.text: We met at that conference in New York.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP.
dialogue.text: I hope I didn't give you the wrong impression.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP.
dialogue.text: You know, I'm a happily married man.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: We've had some deaths in Iron Lake that are very similar to an old Miami Metro case.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Do you remember the Bay Harbor Butcher?

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Cristo. That was a gruesome one.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: I looked at the autopsy photos on the police database.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: What can you tell me about Sergeant Doakes?

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: I sat next to him every day for ten years.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Do you believe that he did it?

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: I did at the time, but there were a few other theories.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: My old captain actually thought it was someone else in the precinct.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Dexter Morgan, but he died years ago.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: And is sitting in my jail cell.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Can I have your old captain's name?

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: I'd like to speak with her.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Did you ever catch the k*ller?

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: I'll be there first thing tomorrow with everything I've got.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Kurt Caldwell's beat feet out of here.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Front door unlocked, safe empty, closets cleaned out.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: And guess what? His gas truck's here.

dialogue.speaker: A POLICE MATTER.
dialogue.text: Emptied out. Still smells like fresh gas.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Can you stay at Kurt's overnight?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Just in case he shows up.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Put that lying son of a b*tch back in my office.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You're not done for the night?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You might actually get away with the Matt Caldwell m*rder charge.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Oh, you did it, all right.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: But I'm not entirely sure my case will hold up enough to convince the D.A. and then the jury.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: But hear this and know this.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I will stake my career, my family, my everything...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I've got one word for you: ketamine.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You picked up a healthy... or unhealthy... amount from Dr. Patel.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Yeah, I needed it for Vincent van Goat.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's the piece of shit who sold the dr*gs that almost k*lled my son.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: We... ended up having an unfortunate encounter.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Miles O'Flynn testified to me that, "Just before he started pounding on me, he poked me in the neck.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Like, with a needle or something."

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: That was the exact same day you picked up the ketamine and several syringes from Dr. Patel.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I saw Logan question him in this very station.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: There's no way he was drugged.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Only because Logan and Teddy showed up at Crystal Bar before you could do it.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: God, believe what you want to believe.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Okay, I have no idea where you're going with this.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I heard he died of an accidental fentanyl overdose.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: He also had ketamine in his system.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: None was found anywhere in his house or his car.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Well, I can't speak to that.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Same drug showing up in their tox report.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: It's what we call a pattern.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: And it's how I know that you, Dexter Morgan...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: The Bay Harbor Butcher was Miami Metro Detective Sergeant James Doakes.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Tomorrow you'll be arraigned for the m*rder of Matt Caldwell.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I'm gonna do my best to see that it sticks and you get life without parole.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: And then, win or lose, you're gonna have a little reunion with your old friend Angel Batista.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I met him at that Cop-Con thing.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: He's on his way up from Miami as we speak.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: We're gonna extradite your ass to Florida where you'll stand trial as the Bay Harbor Butcher.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: A state with the m*therf*cking death penalty.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Why the hell would I do that?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: If you've got something to say, just say it to the camera.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: What if I told you you were right?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Well, then, you'd be admitting to...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I'm saying you were right about Kurt Caldwell.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Ange, you know in your heart that Kurt k*lled Iris.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: yards north of the front door, under a deadwood pile, there's a hatch.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Open it, and you'll see what real evil looks like.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I have dedicated my entire life to this.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Yeah, and you've been met with scorn and ridicule at every turn because you've had a gut feeling, but no proof.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You go to that cabin, and you'll finally have it.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You turned off the camera. What happened?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: My dad, Roger, uh, was a drunk.

dialogue.text: Abusive. He used to knock my mom around. Uh...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: She would get restraining orders against him, but it never seemed to do any good.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: So eventually, she, uh, packed up and left town.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Only she forgot to take me with her, I guess.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Um... after-after my mom left, my dad would take me on the road.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Said it was, um, said it was cheaper than a babysitter and that I would learn more than I learned in school, but really the only thing I learned was that he was a bigger as*h*le than I thought.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: He used to pick up women.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Uh, he'd bring them back to the truck while I was supposed to be asleep.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: He liked to slap them around.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: f*ck them up pretty bad, actually.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: He was just so angry that my mom had left.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: And he knew that they would never call the cops, 'cause even if they did, he'd be long gone.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: ♪ While our hearts were young ♪ After they left, they were bruised and crying and...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: ♪ Tears are fallin' and I feel a pain ♪ And I was just a little kid.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I lived in fear that he would turn on me like that.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: This is all very sad, but we're here about Iris.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I had my own truck routes by then, and, uh, every time that our schedules would overlap, uh, my dad would insist that I buy him a meal.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: Because he said I owed him.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: So, uh, that night, we had dinner together.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: And afterward, I was gassing up my truck, and that's when I saw her.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: And I saw her get in the truck with my dad.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: He was in such a foul mood.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I really should've said something to her.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: ♪ Until then I'll always be ♪ Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: And they drove off and that's the last I saw of her.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I guess I hoped that that's all it was, right?

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: You know, it's rough out there.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: Young girl like you shouldn't be alone.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I wasn't supposed to be alone.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I was supposed to be with my best friend.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I don't want to go home.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: You have no idea what happens to girls out there.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: No one to protect them, keep them safe.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: If you won't give me a ride...

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: ... then let me the f*ck out.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: Yeah, and everybody in town said that, uh, you know, she had run off.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: And I-I guess I wanted to believe that, too.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: That she had started a new life somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: That DNA you found, that's my dad's.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I can't believe what I'm hearing.

dialogue.speaker: ALL VERY SAD
dialogue.text: I had no idea he was capable.

dialogue.text: I mean, I have been living with...

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP

dialogue.text: We have to follow where the evidence points, sir.

dialogue.text: No. Or you'd both be dead.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER

dialogue.text: But it was also weird that he was eating pie with Kurt after he knew Kurt was my prime suspect.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You were right before, and-and you're right now.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER

dialogue.text: There's gonna be a lot of red flags there, if you know what I mean.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: ♪ Release me to the night ♪ ♪ Oh, oh ♪ How much is a plain burger, without cheese or anything?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: What if I don't get fries?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Put it on my tab. Fries, too.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I'm extra sure if you don't call me "ma'am."

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Taking the first bus out tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Just got to make sure I got the fare.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Just take this. Just in case.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: And if you need a place to stay tonight, Desiree over there, she runs a shelter just down the road.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Besides, who checks my petty cash vouchers?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Hey, you want to get out of here?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: You can pull me over by the old Solly farm.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Audrey's got way too many kids over.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: Oh, aren't you glad they didn't have these things when we were younger?

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: when you're off the clock, you're on the clock.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I have the feeling I'm being watched.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: And I have a feeling you're letting this Matt prick get to you, brother.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I got you a couple options.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Oh. Hey, Jim, how much d...

dialogue.text: Everyone's favorite petro-billionaire decided to close down the Tavern for his annual board meeting.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: My tuna sandwich is in there.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Don't you have a test today?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What good's math if people like Edward Olsen destroy the planet?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Well, I know that someone isn't getting their tuna sandwich anytime soon.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Thank you, everyone, for waiting so patiently.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We brought you some, uh, cocoa to warm you up.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's encouraging to see young people with such gusto.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You keep fighting for what you believe in, guys.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: That's what makes this country great, right?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He wants the g*n dropped off at his dad's lodge.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Should we really sell him that g*n?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's called commerce. I'm into it.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Plus, Matt's dad's been a real friend to us for years, so...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I'm not comfortable delivering the g*n. Can't you do it?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Brian and I are picking up Garfield.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I lost the name battle.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Jimmy, I really need you to deliver this g*n.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He really made you bring that thing here?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Man, that guy always has to one-up me.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: ♪ Text back, she all alone... ♪ Bill. Uh, I was with Matt at the store.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I just have some, uh, paperwork for him.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Actually, I just need a signature.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He always ends up holed up in, uh, some bedroom anyways.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Uh, do you think maybe he could just pop out for a minute or...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Come on, man. Get in here.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I brought her here. You know that?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Of course she ends up with him.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You know what they call me?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You know who never gets laid?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You gonna finish this or what?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: No, actually, I think I'm just gonna...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I never should've gotten on that f*cking boat.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What do you mean you told Matt? He wasn't driving.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I lied at my trial so... so that he could go free and-and bang my girlfriends?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: That two grand a week and-and a g*dd*mn Rolex was worth taking the fall.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Well, if Matt was driving, why didn't he stop?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Lost half a mil on some deal because of him.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You want to know the worst part?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Turned the boat away. Totally yielded.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And Matt just drove right f*cking into him anyway.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Uh... this all stays between us, huh?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You're looking at the guy where secrets go to die.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What the f*ck are you doing to me?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Oh, come on. Life is short, dude.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: "The owner is prohibited from operating the w*apon - while intoxicated... "

dialogue.text: Thanks for shopping at Fred's Fish & Game.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogue.text: I don't know who you're talking about.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: but y-you look just like I remember.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Just have one of those faces, I guess.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: If you don't want me, f*cking say it.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Sorry I'm not the guy you're looking for.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: But if-if you want to maybe try the town shelter, it's right on Main Street.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Just tell her Jim Lindsay sent you and she'll take you in.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Whatever you decide, I'm not gonna...

dialogue.text: You seem like a good kid.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: The next bus out of town is, uh, tomorrow night.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: I hope you find whoever you're looking for.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: I'm glad I went first, Dexter.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: I hate to see you like this.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: If you had died first, I would have been lost in the world without you.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Almost ten years without a k*ll.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: And I love you for it.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: ♪ I want him ♪ ♪ To know ♪ ♪ What I have done ♪ ♪ I want him ♪ Please, please, please, please, please.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: Bagged me a white f*cking buck!

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: You see that, man?! Holy shit.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: You see what I did there, uh, Jim?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: But if I'm gonna do this, I need to do it right.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I'm no Eagle Scout, but I do know my knots.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Let's talk about what you did.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: But as bad as that was, that's not the worst thing you've done.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: What, you're just gonna f*cking execute me - or some shit like that?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You think you can get away with that?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Wait, you... You're a serial k*ller?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: But, you know what, you're right.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's not so much that I was.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: This is about the boat, right? Hmm?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Yeah, the part where you were driving.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: The part where the other guy yielded.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: The part where you rammed him anyway.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: The part where five people died - because of you!

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I did everything you said on the boat, okay? It's true.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I admit it. I was wrong.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I was wrong! Just please, - please...

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I promise! I promise, I will never do anything like it again.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I promised the same thing - and look at me now.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Okay? My mom died when I was eight!

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: My dad, he was never around. He was always working!

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I-I-I-I had... I had a sh-shitty childhood, okay?!

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You're blaming this on bad parenting?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: It's true. It's not my fault, okay?

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: You know, I lost both my parents when I was young, too.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: I wouldn't have had any direction if it wasn't for Harry.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: Th-Then you understand. You get it.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: So you're not gonna k*ll me!

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: We're past the point of no return on that one.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: He knows everybody in this town.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: They love him. They would do anything for him.

dialogue.speaker: DEXTER
dialogue.text: And when he finds out what you did to me, he is gonna find you and he is gonna rain down a world of pain on you, man!

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: I thought you were coming to the Christmas Tree Festival.

dialogue.speaker: CHIEF ANGELA BISHOP
dialogue.text: It's kind of a mess here.

dialogue.text: I may be a monster, but I'm an evolving monster.

dialogue.text: ♪ To save us all ♪ Not exactly Miami Bay, but it does have a hole in it.

dialogue.text: What the f*ck are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: ♪ This place ♪ ♪ And with true love and brotherhood ♪ ♪ Each other now embrace ♪ ♪ This holy tide of Christmas ♪ ♪ Doth bring ♪ My life has always been... truth-adjacent.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: ♪ Of comfort and joy ♪ But, starting now, there will be one less lie.

dialogue.text: We make a stop in Albany, right?

dialogue.text: I thought you might need this.

dialogue.speaker: DEBRA
dialogue.text: ... could never get used to this damn cold.

dialogue.text: I thought you didn't know me.
